ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Type of Assessment
Image shown
Emotion displayed in the image
User's response
Notes: 1 = Fearful; 2 = Angry; 3 = Happy; 4 = Sad; 999= No Response, Timeout

ElementDescription: Event triggered by the response
Notes: 1= timeout, no response until timeout; 2= pointerup-mouse, mouse click; 3= pointerup-touch, touchscreen touch

ElementDescription: Response correctness, boolean
Trial reaction time (ms)
Number of correct responses
Proportion correct responses over total
Average reaction time of correct responses to 'test' trials (ms)
Standard deviation of reaction times of correct responses to 'test' trials (ms)
Proportion correct responses for happy images
Total number of happy images
Average reaction time of correct responses to happy images (ms)
Standard deviation of reaction times of correct responses to happy images (ms)
Proportion correct responses for angry images
Total number of angry images
Average reaction time of correct responses to angry images (ms)
Standard deviation of reaction times of correct responses to angry images (ms)
Proportion correct responses for fearful images
Total number of fearful images
Average reaction time of correct responses to fearful images (ms)
Standard deviation of reaction times of correct responses to fearful images (ms)
Proportion correct responses for sad images
Total number of sad images
Average reaction time of correct responses to sad images (ms)
Standard deviation of reaction times of correct responses to sad images (ms)
Participant's response device
Test's script version
